page.title: 19Employment D/W. Grove
page.content: About 120 adults live in Denchworth but the only employment is in farming. Villagers, therefore work in the local towns, mainly Swindon, Wantage, Harwell, Oxford, while some people travel to London. Grove has 5 main employers. Two are industrial research establishments which employ over 600 people. Most of the workforce live in Grove itself. There are 2 dairies, processing and selling locally produced milk, and a sewage plant. Grove has a large number of inhabitants who work in the scientific establishemnts at Didcot, Harwell and Culham. These are mainly young graduates. There is not a high level of unemployment in either areas, the only incident of industrial unrest was in 1983 at the sewage works, part of a national campaign.
